availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Perry (Caldwell co., Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Pernecia Lacey Perry in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on November 15, 1844. Father of Elizabeth F. Perry and Thomas Perry. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed John Hogan as a farm laborer in Caldwell County in 1860. Held four enslaved persons in trust in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 369A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond, p. 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Long Pond, p. 215A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 256.
